Baby John Box Office Day 4: Varun Dhawan's Film Earns ₹23.90 Crore, Faces Heat From Pushpa 2 - News18
summary:
Baby John Box Office Day 4: Varun Dhawan's Film Earns ₹23.90 Crore

Date: December 29, 2024 Source: News18

Varun Dhawan’s film Baby John shows a modest box office recovery, collecting ₹4.25 crore on its fourth day, bringing total earnings to ₹23.90 crore despite tough competition from Pushpa 2.

  • Day 4 collection reaches ₹4.25 crore.
  • Total domestic earnings stand at ₹23.90 crore.
  • The film debuted with ₹11.25 crore but faced a steep decline.
  • Saturday’s recovery is the first positive sign after significant drops in previous days.
  • Pushpa 2 continues to dominate with ₹12.5 crore on the same day.
“The plot feels stretched, with a sluggish first half that echoes Akshay Kumar’s Rowdy Rathore.”

Despite ups and downs, Baby John remains in a competitive box office fight, and its future performance will be closely watched amidst ongoing releases.
newTitle: Baby John Box Office Day 4: Varun Dhawan's Film Earns ₹23.90 Crore

title: Experts question ‘bird strike’ as reason behind South Korea plane crash that killed 179 | Top updates - Hindustan Times
summary:
Experts question ‘bird strike’ as reason behind South Korea plane crash that killed 179

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The tragic Jeju Air flight 7C2216 crash has raised significant questions regarding the actual cause, with experts disputing the likelihood of a bird strike leading to the aircraft's malfunction.

  • The plane was landing at Muan International Airport when it crashed, resulting in the death of 179 people.
  • Experts argue that a bird strike could not have solely caused the malfunctioning of the landing gear.
  • Survivors of the crash are stable and conscious but the majority of passengers have not been identified.
  • The South Korean government declared a period of national mourning following the incident.
“At this point there are a lot more questions than we have answers.” - Gregory Alegi, aviation expert

The ongoing investigation into the crash continues as authorities examine the factors that contributed to this tragic event.
newTitle: Experts Question Bird Strike Hypothesis in Fatal South Korea Plane Crash

title: Reliance pulls out an old video of a very young Mukesh Ambani from archives for Jamnagar refinery celebrations | Watch | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Reliance Celebrates 25 Years of Jamnagar Refinery with Throwback Video of Mukesh Ambani

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Reliance Industries commemorated the 25th anniversary of its Jamnagar refinery by sharing an archival video of a young Mukesh Ambani, emphasizing the refinery's significant impact and the vision of his father, Dhirubhai Ambani.

  • Reliance posted a nostalgic video on X, featuring Mukesh Ambani at the Jamnagar refinery.
  • Ambani spoke about Dhirubhai Ambani's vision of creating world-class infrastructure.
  • The refinery, operational since December 28, 1999, now produces 1.4 million barrels of oil per day.
  • The total investment for the refinery reached $3.5 billion.
  • The facility has dramatically reduced India's dependence on imported refined petroleum while increasing exports.
“Jamnagar has demonstrated unquestionable to the world that if we can dream it, we can do it.” - Mukesh Ambani

As Reliance Industries looks to the future, it aims to reach its Net Zero emission targets by 2035 for the Jamnagar refinery.
newTitle: Reliance Celebrates 25 Years of Jamnagar Refinery with Throwback Video of Mukesh Ambani

title: From lathicharge to water cannons: Bihar police crackdown on protesting BPSC aspirants - The Times of India
summary:
Bihar Police Use Force Against BPSC Aspirants Protests

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Times of India

Protests by Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) aspirants escalated as police employed water cannons and lathi charges to disperse crowds demanding exam reforms.

  • Protests arose from grievances over the BPSC examination process and calls for transparency.
  • Police responded with water cannons and physical force to manage the large gatherings of students.
  • Students expressed frustration with the lack of significant actions taken by the BPSC.
“We are fighting for our future; the authorities need to listen to us,” one protester stated.

This incident highlights ongoing tensions between government agencies and youth aspiring for government jobs in Bihar.
newTitle: Bihar Police Use Force Against BPSC Aspirants Protests

title: Baby John Day 5 India Box Office: Varun Dhawan's action-drama nets only Rs 4.5 crore on Sunday; at the mercy of New Year holiday - PINKVILLA
summary:
Baby John Day 5 India Box Office: Varun Dhawan's action-drama nets only Rs 4.5 crore on Sunday; at the mercy of New Year holiday

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Pinkvilla

Varun Dhawan's 'Baby John' is heading for a disappointing end at the box office, struggling to attract audiences despite its star cast.

  • The film collected Rs 4.5 crore on its fifth day, totaling Rs 27 crore in its extended weekend.
  • Despite a strong opening of Rs 10.75 crore, the film saw a steep drop in subsequent days.
  • Mixed audience reactions and its remake status have hindered its box office performance.
  • The film is expected to conclude its global run under Rs 75 crore, leading to significant losses for the producers.
“The audience is not in any mood to show mercy to the remake movies these days.”

In conclusion, 'Baby John' reflects the challenges faced by filmmakers with remakes in a saturated market, and its underwhelming performance indicates a need for fresh content.
newTitle: Baby John Day 5 India Box Office Performance

title: Delhi police nab juvenile accused of stealing ₹16.44 lakh diamond jewellery from Karol Bagh shop - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi Police Arrest Juvenile for ₹16.44 Lakh Diamond Theft

Published on: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi Police have apprehended a juvenile suspected of stealing diamond jewellery valued at ₹16.44 lakh from a shop in Karol Bagh.

  • The theft occurred on December 11 during the transportation of 10 diamond necklace sets.
  • The accused allegedly stole two diamond necklace sets and four diamond earring sets.
  • The police located the 17-year-old suspect near New Delhi railway station on December 20 following an extensive search involving analysis of CCTV footage.
  • The stolen jewellery was recovered during the suspect's confession.
  • A separate incident involved the arrest of an 18-year-old and his father for stealing gold jewellery in Ludhiana.
“During interrogation, the juvenile confessed to his involvement in the crime. The stolen jewellery was recovered from his possession,” a police officer revealed.

This case highlights ongoing concerns about thefts in urban areas and the involvement of younger individuals in such crimes.
newTitle: Delhi Police Arrest Juvenile for ₹16.44 Lakh Diamond Theft

Afghanistan-Pakistan Border War: What Is The “Hypothetical” Durand Line That Taliban Claims Crossing & Seizing Pak Army Posts - EurAsian Times
summary:
Afghanistan-Pakistan Border War: What Is The “Hypothetical” Durand Line That Taliban Claims Crossing & Seizing Pak Army Posts

Publication Date: December 28, 2024

Source: Eurasian Times

Recent military confrontations along the Durand Line have resulted in significant casualties for both Afghan and Pakistani forces. Following airstrikes by Pakistan in Afghanistan, Afghan forces launched counterstrikes across the border, leading to escalating tensions.

  • 19 Pakistani soldiers were reported killed as Afghan forces crossed the contested Durand Line.
  • The Afghan attacks were in retaliation for previous Pakistani airstrikes that killed 46 Afghan civilians, predominantly women and children.
  • Afghan Defense Minister claims that the operations targeted areas used to launch attacks on Afghanistan.
  • Both nations have acknowledged ongoing clashes and casualties on their sides, indicating a significant rise in border tensions.
“We do not consider it to be the territory of Pakistan… but it was on the other side of the hypothetical line.” - Enayatullah Khowarazmi, Afghan Ministry of Defense

The escalating situation illustrates the persistent instability and the historical complexities surrounding the Durand Line, which has never been officially recognized by Afghanistan. The conflict reflects broader geopolitical dynamics in South Asia.
newTitle: Afghanistan-Pakistan Border Tensions Escalate with Recent Attacks

title: Nagpur: Peanut seller among 4 involved in illegal conversion of ₹2,000 notes; held - Hindustan Times
summary:
Nagpur Police Arrest Four in ₹2,000 Note Conversion Racket

Date: Dec 29, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Nagpur police have arrested a peanut seller and three accomplices involved in a scheme to illegally convert ₹2,000 notes into ₹500 currency.

  • The group allegedly helped individuals exchange now-withdrawn ₹2,000 notes for a commission.
  • Nandalal Maurya, a peanut seller, was hired to operate the racket and assisted in converting currency.
  • The police probe began after a tip-off about the gang's illegal activities.
  • Authorities recovered large sums of cash from the suspects, including ₹60,000 from Maurya's residence.
“Jain promised Maurya ₹200 each for converting 10 notes of ₹2,000 into ₹500 currency notes,” a police officer explained.

The arrests highlight ongoing issues with currency conversion schemes in the wake of the RBI's withdrawal of ₹2,000 notes.
newTitle: Nagpur Police Arrest Four in ₹2,000 Note Conversion Racket

title: Congress MLA Uma Thomas suffers serious injuries after 15-feet fall at JLN Stadium, Kerala - The New Indian Express
summary:
Congress MLA Uma Thomas Injured in 15-Foot Fall at JLN Stadium

Publication Date: 29 Dec 2024 | Source: TNIE

Uma Thomas, Congress MLA of Thrikkakara, fell from a 15-foot-high dais while attending a dance program at Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium, resulting in serious injuries.

  • The accident occurred when Thomas was heading towards the dais for the inauguration of the event.
  • She lost balance and fell onto a concrete platform, sustaining multiple fractures and bleeding.
  • Her condition is stable but she is currently on a ventilator.
  • A tube will be inserted to drain accumulated blood in her lungs, and a CT scan is needed to assess further injuries.
“MLA was unconscious and profusely bleeding... I was shocked to see her fall from the height.” - Sudheesh, eyewitness

The incident highlights concerns over safety measures at public events and the need for secure barriers.
newTitle: Congress MLA Uma Thomas Injured in 15-Foot Fall at JLN Stadium

title: What is highest successful run-chase at Melbourne Cricket Ground in Tests? - Business Standard
summary:
India Set to Chase Record at MCG in 4th Test Against Australia

Publication Date: Date Not Specified | Source: Business Standard

As India gears up to chase a challenging target of 334 runs against Australia in the ongoing 4th Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG), this match could see the highest successful run chase in Test history at this iconic venue.

  • India requires 334 runs to win after Australia opted not to declare their second innings.
  • Mohammed Siraj took a crucial wicket of Marnus Labuschagne, balancing the game in India's favor briefly.
  • Australia’s tail-enders boosted their second-innings total, pushing their lead to 333 runs by Day 4's end.
  • India's Jasprit Bumrah had a missed opportunity to dismiss Nathan Lyon due to a no-ball call, which could affect the outcome.
“Will Australia press on further with their innings or declare overnight? Day 5 promises high drama and a thrilling finish.”

Historically, England holds the record for the highest successful run chase at the MCG with 332 runs against Australia in 1928, a record that remains unbeaten.
newTitle: India Set to Chase Record at MCG in 4th Test Against Australia

summary:
Pushpa 2 (Hindi) 4th Weekend Box Office: Allu Arjun starrer scores another All Time Record; Platform set to enter 700 crore club

Published on: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Pinkvilla

The Allu Arjun led Pushpa 2 is achieving new heights at the box office, reaching impressive ticket sales and revenue figures. It is on track to enter the prestigious 700 crore club.

  • Sold over 4 crore tickets in Hindi.
  • Fourth weekend collections estimated at Rs 26.00 to Rs 26.50 crore.

title: Panamanian President gives major reality check to Trump over China operates Panama Canal claim: ‘Whole world is free…' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Panamanian President José Raúl Mulino gives major reality check to Trump over China operates Panama Canal claim: ‘Whole world is free…'

Date: December 29, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Panamanian President José Raúl Mulino dismissed US President-elect Donald Trump's accusation of Chinese troops operating the Panama Canal as unfounded.

  • President Mulino called Trump's claims "nonsense" and stressed that there is currently no Chinese presence in the canal.
  • Mulino emphasized the canal's Panamanian ownership and independence, stating it is not up for negotiation.
  • He highlighted the respectful diplomatic relationship between Panama and China established after severing ties with Taiwan in 2017.
  • Trump's comments were made during a social media post and at a conference where he expressed grievances over Panama's fees.
  • Mulino asserted the sovereignty of Panama, countering Trump’s threats to seize control of the canal.
“There is not a single Chinese soldier in the canal. For the love of God, you are free, the whole world is free, to visit the canal if you please.” - José Raúl Mulino

This incident highlights ongoing tensions in U.S.-Latin America relations, particularly concerning U.S. accusations regarding China's involvement in the region.
newTitle: Panamanian President Responds to Trump's Allegations About the Panama Canal

summary:
China Unveils Prototype of World's Fastest Train, Capable of Reaching 450 km/h

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Not specified

China has showcased a prototype of what it claims to be the fastest train in the world, with capabilities to travel at speeds of up to 450 kilometers per hour.

  • The train represents a significant advancement in high-speed rail technology.
  • It is designed for both passenger and cargo transport, aiming to improve efficiency and reduce travel time.
  • China’s aim is to enhance its railway network and boost economic development across regions.
“This train is a game-changer for the global transportation sector,” said a spokesperson.

This development signifies China’s continuous commitment to leading in transportation technology and innovation.

South Korea plane crash live: Only 65 victims of plane crash identified - Hindustan Times
summary:
South Korea Plane Crash: 65 Victims Identified Amid National Mourning

Date: December 29, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The Jeju Air flight 7C2216 crashed during landing in Muan, resulting in the deaths of 179 out of 181 passengers. Only two flight attendants survived the horrific accident.

  • The plane was returning from Bangkok with 175 passengers and six crew members.
  • The South Korean government has declared seven days of national mourning for the victims.
  • Widespread condolences have been offered from international leaders, including Pope Francis and the German Chancellor.
  • Five of the deceased were children under ten, with the youngest being just three years old.
  • The crash is the deadliest air disaster in South Korean history since 1997.
“I believe no words of consolation would suffice for the bereaved families who have suffered this tragedy,” - South Korea's acting President Choi Sang-mok.

This tragic event is a somber reminder of the vulnerabilities involved in air travel, prompting a thorough investigation into the causes to prevent future incidents.
newTitle: South Korea Plane Crash: 65 Victims Identified Amid National Mourning

title: Valley fever cases spike in California by 20% compared to 2023: Here’s everything you need to know about - The Times of India
summary:
Valley fever cases spike in California by 20% compared to 2023: Here’s everything you need to know about the infection

Publication Date: October 11, 2023
Source: California Health Department

An alarming 20% rise in valley fever cases has been reported in California compared to the previous year, prompting health officials to alert the public about the infection.

  • Valley fever, or coccidioidomycosis, is caused by a fungus found in soil.
  • Symptoms can include fever, cough, and fatigue, with severe cases requiring hospitalization.
  • The increase is attributed to climate changes affecting environmental conditions.
"This spike is concerning, particularly as many areas face ongoing drought and changes in climate patterns that make conditions ripe for the fungus to spread," said a state health official.

Health experts emphasize the importance of awareness and preventive measures to combat this rising health threat.
newTitle: Valley fever cases spike in California by 20% compared to 2023: Here’s everything you need to know about the infection

title: ISRO to sign off 2024 with space docking experiment mission on December 30 - The Hindu
summary:
ISRO to Launch Space Docking Experiment Mission on December 30, 2024

Published on: December 29, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) is set to launch its final mission of 2024, the PSLV C60/SPADEX Mission, on December 30, aiming to demonstrate critical space docking technology.

  • The launch is scheduled for 9:58 p.m. from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre.
  • SPADEX will utilize two small satellites, SDX01 and SDX02, to conduct in-space docking.
  • The mission aims to enhance India's capabilities for future space endeavors, including satellite servicing and interplanetary missions.
  • Docking is expected to occur in early January 2025.
“SPADEX will serve as a milestone in advancing India’s capabilities in space docking.” - ISRO

This mission marks a significant step in ISRO's quest for advanced space operations, setting the stage for potential crewed missions to the Moon and beyond.
newTitle: ISRO to Launch Space Docking Experiment Mission on December 30, 2024

PKL 2024 Finals HIGHLIGHTS: Haryana Steelers beat Patna Pirates to win their maiden PKL title - Business Standard
summary:
PKL 2024 Finals HIGHLIGHTS: Haryana Steelers beat Patna Pirates to win their maiden PKL title

Published on: December 29, 2024 | Source: Business Standard

The Pro Kabaddi League 2024 concluded with Haryana Steelers defeating Patna Pirates by 9 points, securing their first-ever championship title.

  • Haryana Steelers overcame last season's disappointment as runners-up.
  • This marks the fourth instance in PKL history where a team won the title after being a runner-up the previous season.
  • Patna Pirates were unable to relive their past success of winning from the eliminators.
  • The match ended with a score of 32-23 in favor of Haryana Steelers.
  • Notable player performances included Devank Dalal leading in raid points, and Mohammadreza Shadloui as the top defender.
“Haryana Steelers are now the eighth team in PKL history to win the trophy.”

This victory signifies a remarkable turnaround for the Haryana Steelers, illustrating their growth and resilience in the league.
newTitle: Haryana Steelers Claim Maiden PKL Title, Defeating Patna Pirates

title: What is Nitish Kumar Reddy's IPL earnings? SRH owner Kavya Maran raised his salary 25 times in just one year - India.com
summary:
Nitish Kumar Reddy's IPL Earnings Soar 25 Times in a Year

Publication Date: Not specified Source: India.com

Nitish Kumar Reddy, after an impressive performance in the IPL, has seen a significant raise in his salary, which has increased 25 times within a year, from Rs 20 lakh to Rs 6 crore.

  • Nitish Kumar Reddy debuted in IPL 2023 but gained recognition in 2024.
  • Reddy scored 303 runs with a strike rate of 143 in the 2024 season, including 2 half-centuries.
  • His salary was raised by Kavya Maran, the owner of Sunrisers Hyderabad.
  • He played a critical role in leading his team to the IPL final.
  • Nitish Reddy has been retained for IPL 2025 for Rs 6 crore.
“Nitish earned Rs 20 lakh in 2023, he is set to make Rs 6 crore in the 2025 IPL.”

This remarkable raise underscores the impact of Reddy's performance on his team's success and the IPL's growing financial dynamics.
newTitle: Nitish Kumar Reddy's IPL Earnings Soar 25 Times in a Year
